meanings.definition: A rodent of the genus Rattus
meanings.sent1: The rats scurried across the floor of the old barn.
meanings.sent2: I saw a family of rats living in the abandoned house.
meanings.sent3: The farmer chuckled as he watched the rats play hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: In the city, the crowded streets were like a maze of rats.
meanings.sent5: The children were fascinated by the rats in the petting zoo.

meanings.definition: An exclamation of disappointment or annoyance
meanings.sent1: Rats! I forgot my lunch at home again.
meanings.sent2: Oh rats, I missed the bus to school.
meanings.sent3: Rats, the ice cream shop is closed today.
meanings.sent4: Her favorite team lost the game - rats!
meanings.sent5: Rats, I spilled juice on my new shirt.

meanings.definition: To betray or desert a person or cause
meanings.sent1: He decided to rats on his friends and tell the teacher about the prank.
meanings.sent2: She felt guilty after ratsing on her colleague during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The spy had to rats on his country to save his own life.
meanings.sent4: The soldier chose to rats on his comrades in exchange for freedom.
meanings.sent5: She promised not to rats on her team even under pressure.
